document_data.title: D&D v.3.5 Accessory Update Booklet
document_data.author: Andy Collins, David Noonan, James Wyatt
document_data.mainbody: After the events of the [[Second Sundering]], the [[Dead Three]] became quasi-deities.
document_data.Description:
A quasi-deity once meant that a being was immortal and superior to any mortal creature. Some quasi-deities could not grant spells. A quasi-deity was completely immune to every attempt to tamper with its mind, sap its vitality, or force it into a different form. It had a strong defense against magic but only a limited defense against heat. Weapons not enchanted with magic of an epic scope could not hurt a quasi-deity without problems. These defenses against magic, heat, and non-magical physical attacks grew stronger as a deity rose in rank.{{cite web
| url            = http://archive.wizards.com/default.asp?x=dnd/dnd/20030718a
| title          = D&D v.3.5 Accessory Update Booklet
| accessdate     = 2016-12-16
| author         = Andy Collins, David Noonan, James Wyatt
| date           = 2002-01-01
| work           = 
| publisher      = Wizards of the Coast
| pages = 6
}} After the events of the [[Second Sundering]], the [[Dead Three]] became quasi-deities.

Society.[[Demigod]]s: Creatures born of the union between a deity and a mortal. This was the weakest form of quasi-deity.
Society.Titans: These creatures were created by deities. Titans could come into being deliberately, such as through being forged or willed into existence by a deity or as the offspring of two deities; or unwittingly, such as the blood spilled by a deity.
Society.Vestiges:
Deities who had lost their followers and became nearly powerless. They were regarded as "dead" by mortals, but could still be contacted and still possessed some latent power.

[[True dragon]]s could attain quasi-godhood by mastering the art of a [[dragon ascendant]].

If a quasi-deity amassed a sufficiently high number of followers, it could then ascend to true godhood.

document_data.Notable Quasi-Deities:
* [[Tchazzar]] was a fully developed dragon ascendant who granted spells to his own church.
* The [[Dead Three]]: [[Bane]], [[Bhaal]], and [[Myrkul]].
